comment.author: 37002282@N00
comment._content: This is Kobe City's (Hyogo Prefecture) original Great Buddha, which was constructed during the Meiji Era (1868-1912). Unfortunately, this symbol of "peace" (as well as many, many others) was confiscated during World War II to be melted down for weapons. It was finally replaced in 1991.

comment._content: Another photo, this one taken by Kusakabe, in the Nagasaki University collection. According to Nagasaki University, it was completed in 1889 and consecrated in 1891.
